image.altText: A middle-aged white woman on-stage speaking. She is a wheelchair user

items.synopsis: There are fears in the Australian community that disability is "infecting" and interfering with the lives of non-disabled people, a disability royal commissioner has told its closing ceremony in Sydney.

title.children: Some Australians fear disability is 'infecting' lives of non-disabled people, royal commissioner says

image.altText: A man with cap and white beard at a racing stables leans on a fence.

items.synopsis: It has been revealed a licence suspension handed to a top greyhound trainer was related to an allegation he had used an animal part as a lure for his dogs, as Tasmania's racing integrity watchdog clears him of concerns raised by animal welfare campaigners.

title.children: Top greyhound trainer faces ban over 'lure' allegation, as animal welfare concerns dismissed by watchdog

image.altText: two men dressed in hazmat protective clothing walk with fire personnel outside a building

items.synopsis: Authorities say 30 people were evacuated from the swimming facility in Prestons near Liverpool just after 4pm, after reports that a number of people were feeling unwell.

title.children: 'Toxic cloud': Six children, four adults in hospital after exposure to chemicals at Sydney swim centre

image.altText: MInister Linda Burney during Question Time in a bright pink coat.

items.synopsis: The Indigenous Australians minister says she feels betrayed by Senator Jacinta Nampijinpa Price's comment that First Nations people are not being affected by colonialism because "we now have running water".

title.children: Linda Burney says she was 'shocked' by Nampijinpa Price's comments on Voice debate

image.altText: Shoe and inserts.

items.synopsis: Police are seeking help to identify skeletal remains found on a farm property in the coastal Tasmanian suburb of Clifton Beach, along with shoes, keys and possible ID cards.

title.children: Mystery as human skeleton with black dress shoes found on farmland near Hobart

image.altText: A Carlton AFL shouts with joy as his teammate lifts him up in celebration after a goal.

items.synopsis: Carlton is through to the preliminary final for the first time in nearly a quarter of a century, after a win over Melbourne in their semifinal. Follow the action in our live blog.

title.children: Blues leave it late as they advance to a prelim final

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: Speechless. An incredible final, an unbelievable story. A night to go down in Carlton folklore. The Blues looked done. Out of legs and out of ideas. The Demons had chance after chance to ice the game, but the post kept getting in the way. Turns out all Carlton needed was a flicker of hope. Hope, and Blake Acres who has become the man for the Carlton moment over the last two weeks. He is the hero at the end of a staggering game of football. So much to talk about. Melbourne are out in straight sets. Carlton will play Brisbane in a preliminary final next week. Insane.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: FT: CARLTON WIN BY TWO POINTS! BLUES IN A PRELIM

children.content: (Getty Images)
Speechless. An incredible final, an unbelievable story. A night to go down in Carlton folklore.
The Blues looked done. Out of legs and out of ideas. The Demons had chance after chance to ice the game, but the post kept getting in the way.

Turns out all Carlton needed was a flicker of hope. Hope, and Blake Acres who has become the man for the Carlton moment over the last two weeks. He is the hero at the end of a staggering game of football.
So much to talk about. Melbourne are out in straight sets. Carlton will play Brisbane in a preliminary final next week. Insane.

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: Carlton lead by a point! Weitering at half-back found Hollands, who set Docherty up for a clutch mark at half-forward. He plays on, bombs it to a two-on-one in the square where Acres did the rest. Remarkable. 56 seconds left to play. Carlton by a point.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: 1': BLAKE ACRES KICKS A GOAL! BLUES IN FRONT

children.content: Carlton lead by a point! Weitering at half-back found Hollands, who set Docherty up for a clutch mark at half-forward.
He plays on, bombs it to a two-on-one in the square where Acres did the rest.
Remarkable. 56 seconds left to play. Carlton by a point.

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: Advantage Melbourne. Only just, but their six-point lead comes out of a quarter in which they took some control back and forced Carlton onto the back foot. There was an inflection point in that term where it became clear the first team to settle down and find some composure would take over the game. Melbourne was that team. Carlton got ragged in that quarter, and by the end of it struggled to get their hands on the ball at all. But the margin is only a goal, and this game certainly has a few more swings in it. Thrilling finish awaits us. Hold on to your hats.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: 3QT: Demons take the lead back, up by six points

children.content: (Getty Images)
Advantage Melbourne.
Only just, but their six-point lead comes out of a quarter in which they took some control back and forced Carlton onto the back foot.
There was an inflection point in that term where it became clear the first team to settle down and find some composure would take over the game. Melbourne was that team.
Carlton got ragged in that quarter, and by the end of it struggled to get their hands on the ball at all. But the margin is only a goal, and this game certainly has a few more swings in it.
Thrilling finish awaits us. Hold on to your hats.

image.altText: A young blonde woman looks into the camera, it is a tight shot of her face.

items.synopsis: Ricardo Barbaro is found guilty of the murder of Tasmanian mother-of-one Ellie Price, who was found stabbed to death in her South Melbourne unit in 2020.

title.children: Man guilty of Tasmanian girlfriend's murder

image.altText: Ariarne smiles softly in a selfie of her lying in bed in her silk stripped pajamas.

items.synopsis: The freestyle world record holder said she was "petrified" the discovery in her ovary could impact her "biggest dream" and chances of becoming a mother.

title.children: 'Scary time for me': Olympian Ariarne Titmus undergoes surgery to remove benign tumours

image.altText: Close up of man in suit

items.synopsis: The Russian Security Council secretary's claim comes amid a Russian man being sentenced to 12-and-a-half years jail for sending missile components to the US.

title.children: Putin ally claims Russia has 'neutralised' hundreds of foreign spies

image.altText: Entrance to Dymocks bookstore in Hay Street, Perth

items.synopsis: Dymocks has confirmed that the contact details of over one million customers were obtained and shared on the dark web during last week's data breach.

title.children: Dymocks confirms details of 1.2 million customers shared on dark web

image.altText: iPhone 12 Pro and iPhone 12 Pro Max feature a new, elevated flat-edge stainless steel design

items.synopsis: Apple has continued to contest the French radiation findings, as Belgium says it will still conduct its own review into the model.

title.children: Apple issues iPhone 12 update to end France radiation row

image.altText: a map of Australia with patches of different shades of red in the ocean

items.synopsis: A marine heatwave will likely hit Tasmania just as seafood operators are harvesting oysters, abalone, and salmon for the Christmas dinner table.

title.children: Marine heatwave looming this summer, with potential to impact some much-loved Aussie seafood

image.altText: a man wearing a cap looking at the camera

items.synopsis: Police arrested the 52-year-old at Chatswood Police Station on Tuesday night and charged him with knowingly taking part in the supply of a large commercial quantity of a prohibited drug.

title.children: Former Test cricketer Stuart MacGill charged over alleged role in 'large commercial quantity' cocaine supply

image.altText: A man reaches out to score in a rugby league match

items.synopsis: Cameron Munster and Will Warbrick have combined in the final seconds of the match to deliver Melbourne an incredible finals win over the Roosters. Follow live.

title.children: Spectacular aerial try in final two minutes keeps Melbourne's season alive in remarkable finals finish

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: What. A. GAME! Another heart-pumping, heart-stopping, heart-breaking game in these NRL finals. Melbourne looked to be running out of puff for the final hour of the match, but simply refused to be beaten in a stunning contest. And the try to Will Warbrick, a rugby sevens star the Storm have nurtured into becoming a brilliant NRL winger, is the perfect capper on a night when they were forced to do it without so many stars. Harry Grant was excellent, Cameron Munster and Will Warbrick came up with the game-winning play, but Nick Meaney was the hero for Melbourne tonight. His immaculate composure under the high ball all night, right down to the final short kick-off, combined with some really hard running kept Melbourne's head above water even when they were right up against it.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: The Melbourne Storm have won it at the death!!

children.content: What. A. GAME!
(Getty)
Another heart-pumping, heart-stopping, heart-breaking game in these NRL finals.
Melbourne looked to be running out of puff for the final hour of the match, but simply refused to be beaten in a stunning contest.
And the try to Will Warbrick, a rugby sevens star the Storm have nurtured into becoming a brilliant NRL winger, is the perfect capper on a night when they were forced to do it without so many stars.
Harry Grant was excellent, Cameron Munster and Will Warbrick came up with the game-winning play, but Nick Meaney was the hero for Melbourne tonight.

His immaculate composure under the high ball all night, right down to the final short kick-off, combined with some really hard running kept Melbourne's head above water even when they were right up against it.

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: Cameron Munster kicks cross-field and Will Warbrick makes a sensational clean take up above his head in a contest with Junior Pauga. And he muscles through Corey Allan's cover tackle to slam it down. What a play by the rugby sevens convert who has gotten better with every week of NRL he's played.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: WILL WARBRICK GOES OVER FOR THE STORM!!! Is that the ball game?!

children.content: Cameron Munster kicks cross-field and Will Warbrick makes a sensational clean take up above his head in a contest with Junior Pauga.
(Getty)
And he muscles through Corey Allan's cover tackle to slam it down.
(Getty)
What a play by the rugby sevens convert who has gotten better with every week of NRL he's played.

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: A big right-side shift ends with Marion Seve poking his nose through and earns his team six more. And Harry Grant is smacked in the face by Sam Walker. He stays down, but it's not called.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: 78' Repeat set for the Storm, and a huge missed penalty

children.content: A big right-side shift ends with Marion Seve poking his nose through and earns his team six more.
And Harry Grant is smacked in the face by Sam Walker. He stays down, but it's not called.

image.altText: An aerial shot shows police tape running from a church to a pole and from cars parked beside the church across a street.

items.synopsis: Police say the man left his home in the Victorian city of Geelong to walk his dog at 10pm on Thursday. When the woman awoke to find the dog had returned home alone, she discovered her husband's body.

title.children: Woman discovers husband's body after dog returns home from walk without him, police say

image.altText: A graphic of dozens of large battery storage units near a power substation.

items.synopsis: A proposal for a new giant battery in Tasmania's Central Highlands has been unveiled — with one energy expert saying the technology has a distinct advantage over the massive, and expensive, Marinus Link undersea cable project.

title.children: It would be Australia's second-largest battery if complete — why clean, green Tasmania is the site for it

items.synopsis: How sneaker brands charge up to 10,000 times the cost of manufacturing — and fans eat it up.

title.children: How sneaker companies get away with marking shoes up 10,000 times the cost of manufacturing

image.altText: A sign of Wilton Greens says "land now selling".

items.synopsis: China's largest private developer Country Garden invested millions buying and developing prime sites in Australia. Now, it is among several debt-laden developers selling or downsizing their portfolios.

title.children: Chinese developers entered Australia's property market with big wallets and ambitions. Now they're almost gone

image.altText: an illustration if chris dawson while he sits inside a courtroom

items.synopsis: The judge said the former Sydney school teacher used a degree of manipulation and exploitation to breach the girl's trust in the 1980s.

title.children: Chris Dawson jailed for unlawful sexual activity with schoolgirl

image.altText: Multiple packets of colourful pharmaceutical medicines.

items.synopsis: A trial allowing pharmacists to prescribe medications to Tasmanians in remote areas and aged care will start next year, in a move applauded by pharmacists but received with caution by doctors.

title.children: Australian-first program to allow pharmacists to prescribe medications instead of GPs

image.altText: A photo of a Qantas plane flying in the sky.

items.synopsis: Brisbane, Melbourne and Sydney airports are bracing themselves to be busier than usual these school holidays.

title.children: Airports nationwide prepare for influx of passengers during school holiday rush

image.altText: A person in medical glasses holds up a test tube with the words "monkeypox virus" on it.

items.synopsis: China plans to manage mpox, formerly know as monkeypox, in the same way it handles infectious diseases such as COVID-19 after detecting around 500 cases of the viral infection in August.

title.children: China to manage mpox as disease on par with COVID-19

image.altText: Bob Hawke

items.synopsis: Bob Hawke returned from the remote Northern Territory in 1988 to a divided, partisan parliament. Some say this sank the prospect of a treaty before the idea ever got off the ground.

title.children: In 1988, prime minister Bob Hawke promised a treaty with Aboriginal people. Why did it fail?

image.altText: Missing woman Tina Greer smiles as she gives a 'peace' sign with her hand in a park.

items.synopsis: A Gold Coast woman, now presumed to be dead, was not spoken to by police after allegations her abusive partner had held a gun to her head, an inquest hears.

title.children: Years before her disappearance, Tina Greer was found 'black and blue' but police didn't investigate

image.altText: A woman in a white jumpsuit holds a flaming torch as water falls from a large cauldron above her head

items.synopsis: Some 23 years ago Cathy Freeman lit the 2000 Sydney Olympics flame at Sydney Olympic Park, where she now has a grandstand named after her.

title.children: 'I did not see this day coming': Cathy Freeman honoured with Olympic grandstand named after her

image.altText: The view from a helicopter of a stricken yacht at the base of a cliff.

items.synopsis: The NSW man was treated for minor injuries after being found exhausted in his stricken craft by one of the island's owners.

title.children: Lone sailor, 70, winched to safety after yacht slams into 65m cliffs at Flinders Island

image.altText: Danny and Jessica sitting on the couch at home.

items.synopsis: The premier asks the attorney-general to review WA's parole system, in the wake of recent incidents involving violent offenders on parole who allegedly went on to reoffend.

title.children: Parole review ordered after release of Danny Hodgson's attacker and man who killed ex-partner

image.altText: A composite of two satellite images before and after flooding in Derna

items.synopsis: Satellite images reveal the extent of destruction in the Libyan coastal city of Derna after two dams broke, unleashing a torrent of stormwater on the densely-built city centre.

title.children: A broken dam unleashes a 7-metre wave on Derna. Survivors are left in the rubble

image.altText: An illustration of a SARS-CoV-2 virus particle showing the protruding spike proteins on the virus's surface.

items.synopsis: Here's a quick wrap of the COVID-19 news and case numbers from each Australian jurisdiction from the past week.

title.children: All the latest COVID-19 case numbers from around Australia

image.altText: A cabinet neatly showcases a variety of blue and orange mugs, bowls, plates, glassware and vases.

items.synopsis: It's one of those small things that causes big arguments in a household — should cups, mugs and glasses be stored rim up or rim down?

title.children: Why you might want to store your cups rim down if you live in the tropics
